The Rockefeller University Faculty and Students Club, Inc. (the Club) is a 501(c)(7) organization that operates a social Club on the campus of The Rockefeller University. The purpose of the Club is to encourage the friendly association of its members and their guests for scientific and other intellectual discourse, and/or pleasure and recreation. The books and records of the Club are maintained by the University. The University collects annual Club dues on behalf of the Club. The Club also relies on certain University systems in order to operate. The Club has a liability to the University which represents the University's subsidized portion of the Club's operations in the amount of $2,576,381 as of June 30, 2019.

ExplntnTxt: TO SEEK ALTERNATIVE SOURCES OF SUPPORT TO STRENGTHEN THE UNIVERSITY OF MOUNT OLIVE'S OUTREACH TO STUDENTS AND THE COMMUNITY.

UNDER AN ARRANGEMENT BETWEEN THE TRUSTEES OF THE INSTITUTE OF MUSICAL ART OF THE CITY OF NEW YORK ("THE IMA") AND THE JUILLIARD SCHOOL ("THE SCHOOL"), THE INCOME FROM ALL INVESTMENTS OF THE IMA IS USED TO SUPPORT THE SCHOOL'S OPERATIONS. CERTAIN TRUSTEES AND EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL SERVE AS TRUSTEES OF THE IMA, AND CERTAIN PAID EMPLOYEES OF THE SCHOOL PROVIDE ADMINISTRATIVE AND RECORDKEEPING SERVICES FOR THE IMA. THERE ARE NO REIMBURSEMENTS OR CASH TRANSFERS BETWEEN THE IMA AND THE SCHOOL FOR THESE SERVICES. IN 2002, THE TRUSTEES OF THE IMA DELEGATED INVESTMENT MANAGEMENT AUTHORITY OVER THE IMA'S ASSETS (AN INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO) TO THE SCHOOL, AND THE IMA TRANSFERRED ITS ASSETS (IN CASH) TO THE SCHOOL. THESE FUNDS WERE COMMINGLED WITH THE SCHOOL'S INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO, ALTHOUGH THE IMA REMAINS A SEPARATE LEGAL ENTITY AND SEPARATE FUND RECORDS ARE MAINTAINED TO RECORD IMA ACTIVITIES. THE MANAGEMENT OF THE IMA'S INVESTMENT PORTFOLIO AND THE METHOD USED TO DETERMINE INVESTMENT RETURNS AVAILABLE FOR SPENDING ARE IDENTICAL TO THOSE OF THE SCHOOL. THE VALUE OF THE IMA'S ASSETS AT JUNE 30, 2019 WAS $10,939,065. THE IMA'S NET OF INVESTMENT RETURNS WAS $153,324 FOR THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2019.

STOWERS POLICY INSTITUTE INC'S. ("SPI") PRIMARY ACTIVITY IS TO PROMOTE INNOVATIVE AND ETHICAL BIOMEDICAL RESEARCH, THERAPIES AND CURES, AND TO ADVOCATE FOR A POLITICAL, ECONOMIC, AND SOCIAL ENVIRONMENT THAT ADVANCES, FACILITATES, AND PROTECTS THAT RESEARCH AND THOSE THERAPIES AND CURES.
BIOMED VALLEY DISCOVERIES, INC.'S PRIMARY ACTIVITY IS THE DEVELOPMENT AND MARKETING OF SCIENTIFIC DISCOVERIES. BIOMED VALLEY CORPORATION IS THE 100% OWNER OF BVD STOCK.
GSSIMR RECEIVES THE PER CAPITA FORMULA BASED APPROPRIATION FROM STOWERS INSTITUTE FOR MEDICAL RESEARCH ("SIMR") REPORTED ON FORM 990, PART VIII REVENUE LINE 2A.

SRM AND SIMR, RELATED PARTIES, SHARE FACILITIES AND EMPLOYEES WITH GSSIMR IN ORDER TO PROVIDE THE SUPPORT SERVICES DESCRIBED IN A FUNDING AND SUPPORT SERVICES AGREEMENT. NOTWITHSTANDING THE SERVICES TO BE PROVIDED, NEITHER SRM OR SIMR WILL BE RESPONSIBLE FOR ANY MATTERS RELATING TO (A) DAY-TO-DAY CONDUCT OF GSSIMRS OPERATIONS, INCLUDING DIRECT SUPERVISION OF GSSIMRS EMPLOYEES, OR (B) ACADEMIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES AND FUNCTIONS RELATED TO ACADEMICS. THE CONDUCT OF GSSIMRS ACADEMIC ACTIVITIES AND FUNCTIONS RELATED TO ACADEMICS REMAIN UNDER THE EXCLUSIVE SUPERVISION, DIRECTION, AND CONTROL OF GSSIMR. SRM SUPPORT SERVICES INCLUDE CAMPUS SECURITY, FINANCE AND ACCOUNTING SERVICES, INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY, LEGAL COUNSEL, SCIENCE COMMUNICATIONS AND GRANTS ADMINISTRATION, PLANT MAINTENANCE, LIBRARY SERVICES, PROCUREMENT, RECEIVING, AND LAB RESEARCH REGULATORY AND ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH AND SAFETY TRAINING AND SUPPORT. SIMR SUPPORT SERVICES INCLUDE PROVIDING FACULTY MEMBERS, LABORATORY FACILITIES, AND FINANCIAL SUPPORT FOR THE PREDOCTORAL RESEARCHERS DURING TIME SPENT ON THEIR THESIS RESEARCH IN THE LABORATORIES.

IN FEBRUARY 2013, THE UNIVERSITY ENTERED INTO A CONTRACT OF AFFILIATION (THE CONTRACT) WITH THE NATIONAL UNIVERSITY SYSTEM (NUS), WHICH IS AN ALLIANCE OF OPERATIONALLY INDEPENDENT AND SEPARATELY ACCREDITED NONPROFIT EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, A PUBLIC CHARTER SCHOOL, AND TWO NONPROFIT SERVICE PROVIDERS. THE AFFILIATION AGREEMENT PROVIDES FOR CERTAIN FINANCIAL BENEFITS TO THE UNIVERSITY FOR CURRENT AND FUTURE CAPITAL PROJECT FUNDING AND EXPENSE REIMBURSEMENTS TO PROVIDE ADDITIONAL WORKING CAPITAL TO FUND EXPECTED FUTURE REQUIREMENTS AND NEEDS OF THE UNIVERSITY. ADDITIONALLY, THE CONTRACT INCLUDES A GUARANTEE BY NUS OF ALL OUTSTANDING OBLIGATIONS OF THE UNIVERSITY UNDER THE AFFILIATION. THE UNIVERSITY BOARD OF GOVERNORS ELECTED IN ITS STEAD THE PERSONS WHO ARE ALSO BOARD MEMBERS OF THE OTHER NUS AFFILIATES. THE UNIVERSITY RETAINS ITS NAME, IDENTITY, AND STANDING AS AN INDEPENDENT FULLY ACCREDITED NONPROFIT UNIVERSITY, AS WELL AS ITS COMMITMENT TO ITS CORE MISSION, VISION AND VALUES. THE UNIVERSITY'S AFFILIATION WITH NUS WILL SIGNIFICANTLY STRENGTHEN THE UNIVERSITY'S RESOURCES AND PROVIDE FOR THE LONG-TERM FUTURE OF THE UNIVERSITY.

THE NUS IS AN ALLIANCE OF EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, SERVING DIVERSE LEARNERS FROM HIGH SCHOOL TO DOCTORAL PROGRAMS. THE NUS INCLUDES 6 INDEPENDENT NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT UNDER IRC SECTION 501(C)(3): NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, NATIONAL UNIVERSITY VIRTUAL HIGH SCHOOL, NORTHCENTRAL UNIVERSITY (FKA WESTMED COLLEGE), JOHN F. KENNEDY UNIVERSITY, CITY UNVIVERSITY OF SEATTLE, AND SYSTEM MANAGEMENT GROUP (SMG). SMG IS A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION EXEMPT UNDER IRC SECTION AFFILIATES IN THE NUS. SPECTRUM PACIFIC LEARNING COMPANY LLC AND NATIONAL UNIVERSITY INTERNATIONAL LLC ARE WHOLLY-OWNED BY NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, AND ARE TREATED AS DISREGARDED ENTITIES FOR TAX PURPOSES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF EACH NUS AFFILIATE GOVERNS EACH AFFILIATE INDEPENDENTLY. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS NO AUTHORITY TO REMOVE, REPLACE OR APPOINT A MAJORITY OF THE GOVERNING BODY OF THOSE OTHER AFFILIATES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF EACH AFFILIATE, ACTING IN ITS INDEPENDENT CAPACITY, PERIODICALLY APPOINTS ITS OWN NEW TRUSTEES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS A MAJORITY OVERLAPPING COMPOSITION BETWEEN EACH AFFILIATE OF NUS. IN ADDITION, THE NUS AUDIT FIRM PREPARES A SET OF "COMBINED NOT "CONSOLIDATED" AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS THAT INCLUDE THE EIGHT INDEPENDENT NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT UNDER IRC SECTION 501(C)(3): NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, NATIONAL UNIVERSITY VIRTUAL HIGH SCHOOL, NORTHCENTRAL UNIVERSITY (FKA WESTMED COLLEGE), JOHN F. KENNEDY UNIVERSITY, CITY UNIVERSITY OF SEATTLE, AND SYSTEM MANAGEMENT GROUP.
PART V, LINE 2 THE METHOD FOR DETERMINING THE AMOUNT INVOLVED WAS COST OR CURRENCY CONVERSION.

THE MEMBERS OF YHC REAL ESTATE ARE THE COLLEGE (99.947368%) AND ENOTAH PROPERTIES FOUNDATION, INC. ("ENOTAH", 0.052632%). ENOTAH IS A SECTION 509(A)(3)(A) TYPE I SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION OF THE COLLEGE. ALL OF THESE ENTITIES ARE INCLUDED IN THE CONSOLIDATED, INDEPENDENT AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE COLLEGE. THIS STRUCTURE WAS CREATED SOLELY TO SATISFY FINANCING REQUIREMENTS FOR THE ROLLINS CAMPUS CENTER AND DOES NOT AFFECT THE USE OR ECONOMICS OF THE ROLLINS CAMPUS CENTER FOR THE COLLEGE. FURTHER, THERE ARE NO "SPECIFIED PAYMENTS" BY ANY CONTROLLED ENTITY THAT REDUCE THE UNRELATED INCOME OR INCREASE THE UNRELATED LOSS OF THESE ORGANIZATIONS. THE ROLLINS CAMPUS CENTER HOUSES THE STUDENT CENTER, LIBRARY, DINING HALL AND BANQUET HALL AND RELATED AMENITIES FOR THE COLLEGE.

DONATIONS OF $711,006 FROM THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION TO THE UNIVERSITY WERE DECIDED UPON AT A FOUNDATION TRUSTEES MEETING. THE PRIME PURPOSE OF THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION IS TO PROVIDE SUPPORT TO RICHMOND, THE AMERICAN INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY IN LONDON INC. THE PAYMENT OF $258,940 FROM RICHMOND, THE AMERICAN INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY IN LONDON INC, TO THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION WAS RENTAL ON A PROPERTY USED FOR STUDENT HOUSING WHICH IS OWNED BY THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION. THE PAYMENT OF $82,414 FROM RICHMOND COLLEGE SERVICES LTD WAS FOR ROOM HIRE FOR STUDENTS. RICHMOND COLLEGE SERVICES LTD HAS TWO SHARES IN ISSUE. ONE IS OWNED BY THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION AND THE OTHER IS HELD BY THE PRESIDENT OF THE UNIVERSITY AS A NOMINEE SHAREHOLDER. ANY PROFITS MADE BY RICHMOND COLLEGE SERVICES LIMITED ARE DONATED TO THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION. AS THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION IS A UK REGISTERED CHARITY, THIS EXEMPTS RICHMOND COLLEGE SERVICES LTD FROM PAYING UK CORPORATION TAX. ANY PROFITS DONATED BY RICHMOND COLLEGE SERVICES LIMITED TO THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION ARE IN TURN DONATED TO THE UNIVERSITY. EIGHT TRUSTEES OF RICHMOND, THE AMERICAN INTERNATIONAL UNIVERSITY IN LONDON INC OUT OF A TOTAL OF 14 VOTING MEMBERS ARE ALSO TRUSTEES OF THE RICHMOND FOUNDATION.

The Association of Theological Schools (ATS) is related to the Commission on Accrediting (COA) through overlapping membership. In order to seek accreditation through COA, an institution must first become a member of ATS. Through a support services agreement between ATS and COA, ATS provides personnel, operation, and facility services to COA. ATS charges COA for the direct cost of personnel provided for COA work and for indirect support services.

IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM AND SUBSIDIARIES (D/B/A UNITYPOINT HEALTH) IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM IS AN IOWA NONPROFIT CORPORATION FORMED IN DECEMBER 1994. IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES PROVIDE INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT CARE AND PHYSICIAN SERVICES FROM 36 HOSPITAL FACILITIES AND OVER 400 OUTPATIENT SITES IN IOWA, ILLINOIS AND WISCONSIN. PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND TERTIARY CARE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO RESIDENTS OF IOWA, ILLINOIS, WISCONSIN AND ADJACENT STATES. ON APRIL 16, 2013, IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM BEGAN BEING PUBLICLY KNOWN AS UNITYPOINT HEALTH (THE SYSTEM). THIS NAME CHANGE REFLECTS THE TRANSFORMATION OF CLINICAL PROCESSES UNDERWAY WITHIN THE SYSTEM AND THE ADAPTATION TO BETTER ADDRESS THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING BUILDING A MODEL OF DELIVERING HEALTH CARE THAT COORDINATES CARE AROUND THE PATIENT WHILE FOCUSING ON IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF CARE AND REDUCING COSTS. THE LEGAL NAME OF THE PARENT REMAINS IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM, WITH THE UNITYPOINT HEALTH NAME REFLECTING A DOING BUSINESS AS (D/B/A).

THE NUS IS AN ALLIANCE OF EDUCATIONAL INSTITUTIONS, SERVING DIVERSE LEARNERS FROM HIGH SCHOOL TO DOCTORAL PROGRAMS. THE NUS INCLUDES 6 INDEPENDENT NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT UNDER IRC SECTION 501(C)(3): NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, NATIONAL UNIVERSITY VIRTUAL HIGH SCHOOL, NORTHCENTRAL UNIVERSITY (FKA WESTMED COLLEGE), JOHN F. KENNEDY UNIVERSITY, CITY UNIVERSITY OF SEATTLE, AND SYSTEM MANAGEMENT GROUP (SMG). SMG IS A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION EXEMPT UNDER IRC SECTION 509(A)(3) WHICH PROVIDES SUPPORT AND SERVICES TO ITS TAX-EXEMPT AFFILIATES IN THE NUS. SPECTRUM PACIFIC LEARNING COMPANY LLC AND NATIONAL UNIVERSITY INTERNATIONAL LLC ARE WHOLLY-OWNED BY NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, AND ARE TREATED AS DISREGARDED ENTITIES FOR TAX PURPOSES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF EACH NUS AFFILIATE GOVERNS EACH AFFILIATE INDEPENDENTLY. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS NO AUTHORITY TO REMOVE, REPLACE OR APPOINT A MAJORITY OF THE GOVERNING BODY OF THOSE OTHER AFFILIATES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES OF EACH AFFILIATE, ACTING IN ITS INDEPENDENT CAPACITY, PERIODICALLY APPOINTS ITS OWN NEW TRUSTEES. THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES HAS A MAJORITY OVERLAPPING COMPOSITION BETWEEN EACH AFFILIATE OF THE NUS. IN ADDITION, THE NUS AUDIT FIRM PREPARES A SET OF "COMBINED NOT "CONSOLIDATED" AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS THAT INCLUDE THE EIGHT INDEPENDENT NON-PROFIT ORGANIZATIONS EXEMPT UNDER IRC SECTION 501(C)(3): NATIONAL UNIVERSITY, NATIONAL UNIVERSITY VIRTUAL HIGH SCHOOL, NORTHCENTRAL UNIVERSITY (FKA WESTMED COLLEGE), JOHN F. KENNEDY UNIVERSITY, CITY UNIVERSITY OF SEATTLE, AND SYSTEM MANAGEMENT GROUP.

TO ENTER INTO AND PERFORM ITS OBLIGATIONS UNDER THE LOAN AGREEMENT;III. TO ENGAGE IN ANY LAWFUL ACT OR ACTIVITY AND TO EXERCISE ANY POWERS PERMITTED TO LIMITED LIABILITY COMPANIES ORGANIZED UNDER THE LAWS OF THE STATE OF DELAWARE THAT ARE RELATED OR INCIDENTAL TO AND NECESSARY, CONVENIENT OR ADVISABLE FOR THE ACCOMPLISHMENT OF THE ABOVE-MENTIONED PURPOSES, PROVIDED, HOWEVER, ALL OF THE SAME IS UNDERTAKEN FOR TAX-EXEMPT EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY AND IS CONSISTENT WITH THE COMPANY'S NOT-FOR-PROFIT PURPOSES.

Founded in 1901 as St. Clara College in Sinsinawa, Wisconsin, home of the Sinsinawa Dominicans, Dominican University began as a women's college under the fundamental values that continue to guide the university today. Its rigorous education, diversity of thought, its commitment to social justice, and close mentoring of students to enable them to make a positive difference in the world. In 1922, the university relocated to its current location in River Forest, Illinois, where it was renamed to Rosary College. The new college rapidly expanded its curriculum and reach into the next decades establishing the nation's first study abroad programs, launching graduate programs and becoming coeducational. To reflect its stature as a respected, comprehensive and modern university, it was renamed to Dominican University in 1997. Today, Dominican is a premier Catholic University that ranks among the top masters' level universities in the Midwest. While maintaining its core Catholic identity, the University enrolls and mentors students of all faith backgrounds. Living out the ideals of founding sisters and those of Father Samuel Mazzuchelli, founding Father of the Sinsinawa Dominicans, the university is committed to giving compassionate service and to participating in the creation of a more just and humane world. Gifts received from the Sinsinawa Dominican Order in the Fiscal Year 2018-2019 was $78,950.

IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM AND SUBSIDIARIES (D/B/A UNITYPOINT HEALTH) IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM IS AN IOWA NONPROFIT CORPORATION FORMED IN DECEMBER 1994. IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM AND ITS SUBSIDIARIES PROVIDE INPATIENT AND OUTPATIENT CARE AND PHYSICIAN SERVICES FROM 33 HOSPITAL FACILITIES AND OVER 400 OUTPATIENT SITES IN IOWA, ILLINOIS AND WISCONSIN. PRIMARY, SECONDARY AND TERTIARY CARE SERVICES ARE PROVIDED TO RESIDENTS OF IOWA, ILLINOIS, WISCONSIN AND ADJACENT STATES. ON APRIL 16, 2013, IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM BEGAN BEING PUBLICLY KNOWN AS UNITYPOINT HEALTH (THE SYSTEM). THIS NAME CHANGE REFLECTS THE TRANSFORMATION OF CLINICAL PROCESSES UNDERWAY WITHIN THE SYSTEM AND THE ADAPTATION TO BETTER ADDRESS THE HEALTH CARE NEEDS OF COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING BUILDING A MODEL OF DELIVERING HEALTH CARE THAT COORDINATES CARE AROUND THE PATIENT WHILE FOCUSING ON IMPROVING THE QUALITY OF CARE AND REDUCING COSTS. THE LEGAL NAME OF THE PARENT REMAINS IOWA HEALTH SYSTEM, WITH THE UNITYPOINT HEALTH NAME REFLECTING A DOING BUSINESS AS (D/B/A).
LEGAL DOMICILE OF TRUST THE CHARITABLE REMAINDER TRUSTS ARE LEGALLY DOMICILED IN DC, FL, GA, KY, MA, MD, MO, NC, NH, NJ, OH, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, VT, WY.

As part of a New Markets Tax Credit project in Lewisburg, PA, Bucknell University loaned $12,022,694 in December 2010 to an entity controlled by Wells Fargo Community Investment Holdings, LLC. That entity then loaned the $12,022,694 (loan A) and an additional $4,167,306 (loan B) to Wells Fargo Community Development Enterprises 7, LLC, which in turn loaned those funds to Bucknell Real Estate, Inc. in December 2010. The funds were used for the acquisition and improvement of certain properties in Lewisburg, PA. During the tax year, the university wound down the New Markets Tax Credit project resulting in the entire loan becoming the responsibility of Bucknell Real Estate, Inc.The loans require interest payable quarterly at 1.01% with principal payments beginning April 1, 2018 through January 1, 2046. Interest due to Bucknell University from the controlled entity relating to the loan was $163,519 for the year ended June 30, 2019.
